body: Could you share the output of `alacritty --print-events`?

body:
Sorry for the delay, but I don't think there's anything Alacritty can do. I've reported the issue upstream in https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/1302.

If you want to help out with the issue resolution, I'd recommend subscribing to the upstream issue, so you can answer any potential questions that come up.
@chrisduerr thanks for looking into it! I'll see if I can help out over on the winit side.

Over at https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/pull/1303 @murarth has a winit patch for this. I want to try it out but I can't figure out how to build with a custom version of winit. (This is my first time using Rust/Cargo.) Any pointers?

I tried many things, but here are the two that I would've most expected to work:

First, I tried adding a Cargo.toml "patch" for the winit dependency to point at @murarth's bugfix branch:

``` diff
 [patch.crates-io]
 servo-freetype-sys = { path = "servo-freetype-proxy" }
+winit = { git = "https://github.com/murarth/winit", branch = "x11-fix-suspend" }
```

However, Cargo didn't want to use this dependency.

body:
@cespare Alacritty is not depending on `winit` directly, instead it depends on `glutin`, so to test a `winit` patch you should do the following.

1: Look at `alacritty/Cargo.toml` and see the what version of glutin we're using.
2: Clone this version and place, outside of alacritty workspace. (so `git clone https://github.com/chrisduerr/glutin` for now)
3: Change the `glutin` version to your cloned one in the `Cargo.toml` you've looked initially, should be `glutin = { path = "../../glutin/glutin" }` .
4: Then clone the `winit` you want to test and change the `glutin/glutin/Cargo.toml` `winit` to your cloned `winit`, should be `winit = { path = "../../winit" }`
5: Compile alacritty, you should see `winit` and `glutin` from your path.

If you have any questions let me know.
